<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>for a short time on the shore enjoying the transitory <lb n="c57-0147__main__4"/> twilight & then retired to the Inn and contem<lb n="c57-0147__main__5"/>plated the lovely scene of waters, mountains <lb n="c57-0147__main__6"/>& woods obscured in darkness yet still allow<lb n="c57-0147__main__7"/>ing<lb n="c57-0147__left_margin__1"/>displaying their<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0147__main__d3e27788"/>their<del eID="c57-0147__main__d3e27788"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0147__main__d3e27793"/>dark<del eID="c57-0147__main__d3e27793"/>black outlines– The wind which <lb n="c57-0147__main__8"/> had fallen in the south now rose with great <lb n="c57-0147__main__9"/> violence in the west—the moon had <lb n="c57-0147__main__10"/> reached her summit in the heavens <lb n="c57-0147__main__11"/>& was beginning to descend the clouds <lb n="c57-0147__main__12"/> swept across it swifter than the <lb n="c57-0147__main__13"/> flight of the vulture and dimmed her <lb n="c57-0147__main__14"/> rays while the lake reflected the scene<lb n="c57-0147__main__15"/>of the busy heavens <metamark function="insert">^</metamark><mdel>m</mdel> made still busier by the <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>restless waves <lb n="c57-0147__main__16"/> that were beginning to rise— <mdel>s</mdel>Suddenly <lb n="c57-0147__main__17"/> a heavy storm of rain descended.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0147__main__18"/> I<del rend="smear" sID="c57-0147__main__d3e27869"/>t<del eID="c57-0147__main__d3e27869"/> had been calm during the day but <lb sID="c57-0147__main__d3e27884"/>ha<del eID="c57-0147__main__d3e27884"/> obscured the shapes of <lb n="c57-0147__main__20"/> objects a thousand fears arose in <lb n="c57-0147__main__21"/> my mind – I was anxious and watchful <lb n="c57-0147__main__22"/> while my right hand grasped a pistol <lb n="c57-0147__main__23"/> which was hidden in my bosom — <lb n="c57-0147__main__24"/> Every sound terrified me, but I resoldved <lb n="c57-0147__main__25"/> that I would sell my<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0147__main__d3e27903"/>s<del eID="c57-0147__main__d3e27903"/> life dearly &<lb n="c57-0147__main__26"/> not <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0147__main__d3e27910"/>die<del eID="c57-0147__main__d3e27910"/>relax the conflict that impended untill <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0147__main__d3e27918"/>my adversary<del eID="c57-0147__main__d3e27918"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0147__main__d3e27921"/>lay<del eID="c57-0147__main__d3e27921"/><del sID="c57-0147__main__d3e27939"/>t.<del eID="c57-0147__main__d3e27939"/>my own life, or that of my adversary were extinguished<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0147__main__28"/> Elizabeth observed my agitation for <lb n="c57-0147__main__29"/> some time in timid & fearful silence <lb n="c57-0147__main__30"/>At length she said — What is it, my dear <lb n="c57-0147__main__31"/> Victor, that agitates you? What is it <lb n="c57-0147__main__32"/> you fear?<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0147__main__33"/> Oh peace, peace, my love, I replied, <lb n="c57-0147__main__34"/> this night and all will be safe – but <lb n="c57-0147__main__35"/> this night is dreadful very dreadful.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0148__main__1"/> I passed an hour in this state of <lb n="c57-0148__main__2"/> mind when suddenly I reflected how dreadful <lb n="c57-0148__main__3"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0148__main__d3e27994"/>such a<del eID="c57-0148__main__d3e27994"/>the combat <mdel>as</mdel>which I momently expected <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0148__main__d3e28016"/>would<del eID="c57-0148__main__d3e28016"/>to take <lb n="c57-0148__main__4"/> place would be to my wife and I earnestly <lb n="c57-0148__main__5"/> entreated her to retire – resolving not to join <lb n="c57-0148__main__6"/> her untill I had obtained some knowledge <lb n="c57-0148__main__7"/> as to the situation of my enemy.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0148__main__8"/> She left me and I continued some <lb n="c57-0148__main__9"/> time walking up and down the passages <lb n="c57-0148__main__10"/> of the house & inspecting every corner <lb n="c57-0148__main__11"/> that might afford a retreat to my <lb n="c57-0148__main__12"/> adversary – But I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0148__main__d3e28048"/>sa<del eID="c57-0148__main__d3e28048"/> saw no trace of him&<lb n="c57-0148__main__13"/><lb n="c57-0148__left_margin__1"/>was beg<mdel>an</mdel>inning to consider <del next="#c57-0148.03" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0148__main__d3e28076"/>what was my best<del eID="c57-0148__main__d3e28076"/>that some fortunate chance<lb n="c57-0148__main__14"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0148__main__d3e28084" xml:id="c57-0148.03"/>mode of proceeding<del eID="c57-0148__main__d3e28084"/>had intervened to prevent the execution of his menace, – When suddenly <lb n="c57-0148__main__15"/> I heard a shrill & dreadful scream.– <lb n="c57-0148__main__16"/> It came from the room into which <lb n="c57-0148__main__17"/> Elizabeth had retired.<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0148__main__d3e28104"/>with a servant<del eID="c57-0148__main__d3e28104"/><lb n="c57-0148__main__18"/> As I heard it the whole truth rushed <lb n="c57-0148__main__19"/> to my mind my arms dropped – the <lb n="c57-0148__main__20"/> motion of every muscle & fibre was <lb n="c57-0148__main__21"/> suspended I could feel the b<mdel>r</mdel>lood trick<lb n="c57-0148__main__22"/>ling<del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0148__main__d3e28133"/>from<del eID="c57-0148__main__d3e28133"/> in my veins – <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0148__main__d3e28138"/>The scream<del eID="c57-0148__main__d3e28138"/>& tingling in my feet<lb n="c57-0148__main__23"/> This state lasted but an instant <lb n="c57-0148__main__24"/> the scream was repeated & I rushed <lb n="c57-0148__main__25"/> into the room. Great God why did I <lb n="c57-0148__main__26"/> not then expire – Why I am I here to <lb n="c57-0148__main__27"/> relate the d<mdel>i</mdel>estruction of the best hope <lb n="c57-0148__main__28"/>&<mdel>d</mdel>the purest creature of earth – She was <lb n="c57-0148__main__29"/> there – lifeless & inanimate – thrown <lb n="c57-0148__main__30"/> across the bed her head hanging <lb n="c57-0148__main__31"/> down her pale & distorted features half <lb n="c57-0148__main__32"/> covered by her hair – Every where I turn <lb n="c57-0148__main__33"/> I see the same figure —Her bloodless<lb n="c57-0149__main__1"/> arms & relaxed figure flung by the mur<lb n="c57-0149__main__2"/>derer on its <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>bridal bier — Could I behold this & and <lb n="c57-0149__main__3"/> live– Alas life is obstinate <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0149__main__d3e28227"/>& clinging<del eID="c57-0149__main__d3e28227"/>it clings closest where it <lb n="c57-0149__main__4"/> is most hated– for a moment only did <lb n="c57-0149__main__5"/> I lose recollection – I fainted.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0149__main__6"/> When I recovered I found myself in <lb n="c57-0149__main__7"/> the midst of the people of inn – Their <lb n="c57-0149__main__8"/> countenances expressed a breathless terror <lb n="c57-0149__main__9"/> but the horror of others appeared <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0149__main__d3e28251"/>but<del eID="c57-0149__main__d3e28251"/>only as a <lb n="c57-0149__main__10"/> mockery <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>a shadow of the feelings that oppre<mdel>d</mdel>ssed <lb n="c57-0149__main__11"/><lb n="c57-0149__left_margin__1"/>me. I escaped from them <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>to the room where lay the body <lb n="c57-0149__main__12"/> of Elizabeth – my love — my wife – so lately <lb n="c57-0149__main__13"/> living – so dear –so worthy – She had <lb n="c57-0149__main__14"/> been moved from the posture in <lb n="c57-0149__main__15"/> which I had first beheld her & now <lb n="c57-0149__main__16"/> as she lay her head upon her arm <lb n="c57-0149__main__17"/> and <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0149__main__d3e28319"/>h<del eID="c57-0149__main__d3e28319"/> a hankerchief thrown across <lb n="c57-0149__main__18"/> her face & neck I might have sup<lb n="c57-0149__main__19"/>posed her asleep – I rushed towards her &<lb n="c57-0149__main__20"/> embraced her with ardour but the <lb n="c57-0149__main__21"/> deathly coldness of the body told me that <lb n="c57-0149__main__22"/> what I now held in my arms had <lb n="c57-0149__main__23"/> ceased to be the Elizabeth whom I <lb n="c57-0149__main__24"/> had loved & cherished, the murderous <lb n="c57-0149__main__25"/> grasp of the fiend was on her neck <lb n="c57-0149__main__26"/>& the breath had ceased to issue from <lb n="c57-0149__main__27"/> her <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0149__main__d3e28352"/>sweet<del eID="c57-0149__main__d3e28352"/> lips.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0149__main__28"/> While I still held her in my arms <lb n="c57-0149__main__29"/> in the agony of despair I happened to <lb n="c57-0149__main__30"/> look up. The room <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0149__main__d3e28364"/>which<del eID="c57-0149__main__d3e28364"/> had before <lb n="c57-0149__main__31"/> been quite dark and I felt a kind of <lb n="c57-0149__main__32"/> panic on seeing the pale yellow light <lb n="c57-0149__main__33"/> of the moon illuminate the chamber<lb n="c57-0150__main__1"/> the shutters had been thrown back and with <lb n="c57-0150__main__2"/> a sensation of horror not to be described I <lb n="c57-0150__main__3"/> saw at the open window a figure the most <lb n="c57-0150__main__4"/> hideous & abhorred – A grin was on the face <lb n="c57-0150__main__5"/> of the monster. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0150__main__d3e28394"/>that<del eID="c57-0150__main__d3e28394"/>he seemed to jeer as with <lb n="c57-0150__main__6"/> his fiendish finger he pointed towards the <lb n="c57-0150__main__7"/> corpse of my wife—I rushed towards the window <lb n="c57-0150__main__8"/> and drawing a pistol from my bosom –shot– <lb n="c57-0150__main__9"/> but he eluded me – <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0150__main__d3e28413"/>he<del eID="c57-0150__main__d3e28413"/> leapt from his station <lb n="c57-0150__main__10"/> and <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0150__main__d3e28418"/>run<del eID="c57-0150__main__d3e28418"/> running with <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>the swiftness of lightning <lb n="c57-0150__main__11"/> plunged in to the lake. The report of my <lb n="c57-0150__main__12"/> pistol brought a crow<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0150__main__d3e28438"/>e<del eID="c57-0150__main__d3e28438"/>d into the room <lb n="c57-0150__main__13"/> I pointed to where he had disappeared &<lb n="c57-0150__main__14"/> we followed him with boats & cast nets <lb n="c57-0150__main__15"/> but in vain and passing several hours <lb n="c57-0150__main__16"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0150__main__d3e28449"/>re<del eID="c57-0150__main__d3e28449"/> in the search returned hopeless – <mdel>m</mdel>Most <lb n="c57-0150__main__17"/> of my companions believeing it to have <lb n="c57-0150__main__18"/> been a form conjured by my fancy. How<lb n="c57-0150__main__19"/>ever after having <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0150__main__d3e28473"/>quitte<del eID="c57-0150__main__d3e28473"/> landed they pro<lb n="c57-0150__main__20"/>ceeded to search the country <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0150__main__d3e28482"/>goin<del eID="c57-0150__main__d3e28482"/> parties <lb n="c57-0150__main__21"/> going in different directions among the <lb n="c57-0150__main__22"/> woods & vines. I did not accompany them <lb n="c57-0150__main__23"/>for the exhaustion that now seized on <lb n="c57-0150__main__24"/> me I was exhausted; a film covered my <lb n="c57-0150__main__25"/> eyes and my skin <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0150__main__d3e28506"/>burned<del eID="c57-0150__main__d3e28506"/>was parched with <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0150__main__d3e28513"/>t<del eID="c57-0150__main__d3e28513"/> the heat <lb n="c57-0150__main__26"/> of fever. In this state I lay on a bed hardly <lb n="c57-0150__main__27"/> conscious of what had happened & my eyes <lb n="c57-0150__main__28"/> wandered round the room as if to seek <lb n="c57-0150__main__29"/> somthing that I had lost. At length I remem<lb n="c57-0150__main__30"/>bered that my father would anxiously <lb n="c57-0150__main__31"/> expect the return of Elizabeth & myself <lb n="c57-0150__main__32"/> and that I must return alone. This <lb n="c57-0150__main__33"/> reflection brought tears into my eyes & I <lb n="c57-0150__main__34"/> wept for a long time. I reflected o<mdel/>n my <lb n="c57-0150__main__35"/> misfortunes & their cause and was bewildered <lb n="c57-0150__main__36"/> in a cloud of wonder and horror. The<lb n="c57-0151__main__1"/> death of William, the execution of Justine <lb n="c57-0151__main__2"/> the murder of Cl<mdel>ai</mdel>erval & now of my wife – even <lb n="c57-0151__main__3"/><lb n="c57-0151__left_margin__1"/>at that moment I knew not that my <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0151__main__d3e28593"/>my<del eID="c57-0151__main__d3e28593"/> only <lb n="c57-0151__main__4"/> remaining friends were safe from the malignity <lb n="c57-0151__main__5"/> of the fiend – my father even now might be <lb n="c57-0151__main__6"/> writhing under his grasp & Ernest might be <lb n="c57-0151__main__7"/> dead at his feet – This reflection made me <lb n="c57-0151__main__8"/> shudder and recalled me to action. <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0151__main__d3e28607"/>I sta<del eID="c57-0151__main__d3e28607"/> I <lb n="c57-0151__main__9"/> started up & resolved to return to Geneva <lb n="c57-0151__main__10"/> with <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0151__main__d3e28616"/>every<del eID="c57-0151__main__d3e28616"/>all possible speed. There were no horses <lb n="c57-0151__main__11"/> to be procured and I must return by the <lb n="c57-0151__main__12"/> lake but the wind was <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0151__main__d3e28630"/>now<del eID="c57-0151__main__d3e28630"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0151__main__d3e28633"/>against me<del eID="c57-0151__main__d3e28633"/>unfavourable<lb n="c57-0151__main__13"/> and the rain fell in torrents. It was however <lb n="c57-0151__main__14"/> hardly yet morning and I <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>might reasonably hope<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0151__main__d3e28656"/>d<del eID="c57-0151__main__d3e28656"/> to arrive <lb n="c57-0151__main__15"/><del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0151__main__d3e28662"/>that ni<del eID="c57-0151__main__d3e28662"/> by night –I hired a number of <lb n="c57-0151__main__16"/> men to row and took an oar myself for <lb n="c57-0151__main__17"/> I had always <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0151__main__d3e28671"/>felt<del eID="c57-0151__main__d3e28671"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>experienced relief <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>from mental <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0151__main__d3e28696"/>strain<del eID="c57-0151__main__d3e28696"/> torment in bodily exercise. <lb n="c57-0151__main__18"/> But the overflowing misery I now felt <lb n="c57-0151__main__19"/>& the excess of agitation that I endured <lb n="c57-0151__main__20"/> rendered me incapable of any exertion–I <lb n="c57-0151__main__21"/> threw down the oar & leaning my head <lb n="c57-0151__main__22"/> upon my hands gave way to every <lb n="c57-0151__main__23"/> gloomy idea that arose—If I looked up <lb n="c57-0151__main__24"/> I saw the scenes which were familiar <lb n="c57-0151__main__25"/> to me in my happier <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0151__main__d3e28728"/>days<del eID="c57-0151__main__d3e28728"/>time and which I had <lb n="c57-0151__main__26"/> contemplated but the day <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>before in the compa<lb n="c57-0151__main__27"/>ny of her who was <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>now but a shadow & a <lb n="c57-0151__main__28"/> recollection – tears streamed from my <lb n="c57-0151__main__29"/> eyes – I looked on the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0151__main__d3e28774"/>waters<del eID="c57-0151__main__d3e28774"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>lake<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0151__main__d3e28788"/>& sa<del eID="c57-0151__main__d3e28788"/> the <lb n="c57-0151__main__30"/> rain had ceased for a moment & I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0151__main__d3e28793"/>saw<del eID="c57-0151__main__d3e28793"/><lb n="c57-0151__main__31"/> saw the fish play in the waters as I <lb n="c57-0151__main__32"/> had done <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0151__main__d3e28804"/>the day bef<del eID="c57-0151__main__d3e28804"/> but <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0151__main__d3e28807"/>four<del eID="c57-0151__main__d3e28807"/> a few <lb n="c57-0151__main__33"/> hours before – they had then been observed by <lb n="c57-0151__main__34"/> Elizabeth. Nothing is so painful to the human <lb n="c57-0151__main__35"/> mind as great & sudden change – The sun<lb n="c57-0152__main__1"/> might shine or the clouds might lower – but <lb n="c57-0152__main__2"/> nothing could appear to me as it had done the <lb n="c57-0152__main__3"/> day before – <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0152__main__d3e28830"/>Eve<del eID="c57-0152__main__d3e28830"/> A fiend had snatched from <lb n="c57-0152__main__4"/> me every hope of future happiness. No crea<lb n="c57-0152__main__5"/>ture had ever been so miserable as I was <lb n="c57-0152__main__6"/> so frightful an event was single upon <lb n="c57-0152__main__7"/> earth.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0152__main__8"/> But why should I dwell upon the <lb n="c57-0152__main__9"/> incidents that followed this last over<lb n="c57-0152__main__10"/>whelming event – Mine has been a tale <lb n="c57-0152__main__11"/> horrors– I have <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c57-0152__main__d3e28862"/>now<del eID="c57-0152__main__d3e28862"/> reached their ac<del rend="smear" sID="c57-0152__main__d3e28865"/>h<del eID="c57-0152__main__d3e28865"/>me <lb n="c57-0152__main__12"/> and what I must now relate can but <lb n="c57-0152__main__13"/> be <mdel/>tedious to you now that one by one <lb n="c57-0152__main__14"/> my friends were snatched away & I was <lb n="c57-0152__main__15"/> left desolate. My own strength is exhausted <lb n="c57-0152__main__16"/>& I must tell in few words What remains <lb n="c57-0152__main__17"/> of my hideous narration.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0152__main__18"/> I arrived at Geneva. My fathe &<lb n="c57-0152__main__19"/> Ernest yet lived but the former was <lb n="c57-0152__main__20"/> unable to bear the miserable tidings <lb n="c57-0152__main__21"/> that I bore — I see him now excellent <lb n="c57-0152__main__22"/>& venerable old man – his eyes wandered <lb n="c57-0152__main__23"/> in vacancy for they had lost their <lb n="c57-0152__main__24"/> charm & delight – his neice his more <lb n="c57-0152__main__25"/> than daughter whom he doated on <lb n="c57-0152__main__26"/> with all the affection of a man who <lb n="c57-0152__main__27"/> in the decline of life having few affec<lb n="c57-0152__main__28"/>tions clings <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>more earnestly to those that remain.
